Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls regarding your chosen art-form.

feats.name: Bodybuilder
feats.description:
You’re big, strong, and muscular. How much can you bench?
Gain a Free Re-roll when lifting, carrying, or breaking something.

feats.name: Car Jump
feats.description:
You speed up an improvised ramp and make your ride jump in the air. Everyone holds their breath.
[Full Turn] While driving, you can have your ride jump over something to automatically pass an obstacle or barrier, or to gain +2 Speed during a Chase.
Upon landing, the ride loses 1 Armor. You can use this Feat with all rides that travel on land or water, but not with flying Rides.

feats.name: Cash Flow
feats.description:
You’re from old money, or simply have quite a lot of cash on hand. Either way, money is no problem!
You start the game with 3 Cash. Gain 1 Cash at the beginning of each Session, unless you are imprisoned or lost in the middle of nowhere.

feats.name: Combo
feats.description:
After each strike, there is always another, faster than the first. One-two! Come on!
After hitting an Enemy, you can spend 1 Adrenaline/Luck to deal 1 additional Grit. You can spend several to continue the combo and deal additional damage.

feats.name: Counter
feats.description:
The best defense is always a good offense.
React against an Enemy by rolling Brawn+Fight instead of the requested Skill.
You ignore all -1s from Conditions and circumstances.

feats.name: Crazy Stunt
feats.description:
You’re the reason why they invented those “Don’t try this at home” disclaimers.
[Full Turn] When you’re driving, you can make an absolutely crazy maneuver in order to win the chase.
Destroy your ride and flip a coin. Heads: the Director fills in 1 Need box. Tails: the Director fills in 5 Need boxes. If, after this maneuver, all Need boxes are full, you won the chase.

feats.name: Detective
feats.description:
The crime-scene speaks to you. Where others see chaos, you know how to spot a clue.
Gain a Free Re-roll when looking for clues, following trails, or searching a room.

feats.name: Full Throttle!
feats.description:
You’re a speed junkie who lives life in the fast lane.
When you’re behind the wheel of a ride, you ignore penalties from the Nervous Condition and from Top Speed.
Once per chase, when you reach Top Speed, you gain 1 Adrenaline/Luck.

feats.name: Flying Kick
feats.description:
No enemy is out of reach for your deadly kicks.
Attack an Enemy within Close or Medium Range, gain +1 to the roll.
Additionally, you can always attack an Enemy within Close Range while bare-handed, and you don’t need to spend Adrenaline/Luck to do so.

feats.name: Get Down!
feats.description:
You grab your friend and drag them away from danger one second before disaster.
[Full Turn] You and another Hero quickly hide, dodge a hail of bullets, or avoid being run over without needing to roll the dice.

feats.name: Gunslinger
feats.description:
The gun is an extension of your arm. Every shot hits its mark.
Gain a Free Re-roll when using, repairing, evaluating, or handling a pistol or revolver.

feats.name: Hacker
feats.description:
You’re a computer wizard. No firewall can stop you.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls about computers, to hack a system or to bypass IT security measures.

feats.name: Hard to Kill
feats.description:
It doesn’t matter what they throw at you. You keep standing back up.
When you fill in your Bad Box, you gain 1 Adrenaline/Luck and +1 to your next roll.

feats.name: Head on a Swivel
feats.description:
You’re always ready to spot what’s coming.
Gain a Free Re-roll when preempting dangers or ambushes, or trying to locate lurking enemies.

feats.name: Heartbreaker
feats.description:
Nobody can resist your damned smile.
Gain a Free Re-roll when seducing or making a good impression on others.

feats.name: High Culture
feats.description:
You’ve studied and it shows.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls to recall information about general culture, literature, history, and geography.

feats.name: Hunter
feats.description:
You have predator instincts and know how to move in the wilds.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to follow or hunt an animal, to find your bearings, or to hide while in the wilds.

feats.name: Intimidation
feats.description:
You’re an ice-cold tough guy. You’re truly scary.
Gain a Free Re-roll when intimidating or interrogating somebody.

feats.name: Intuition
feats.description:
You notice hidden details other people miss.
[Quick Action] Ask the Director to give you a clue or suggestion, or find the Weak Spot of an Enemy.

feats.name: I’ll Make a Phone Call
feats.description:
You have a contact, a friend, or a favor you can call in. It’s just a phone call away.
[Full Turn] You call one of your contacts asking for a piece of information, a favor, a ride, or up to 3 Cash. You gain whatever you asked for during the next Time-Out.

feats.name: Knife Thrower
feats.description:
Knives, axes, shuriken, or gaming cards. If you can hold it, you can throw it.
Gain +1 when using a throwing weapon.

feats.name: Lie to Me
feats.description:
You can understand the person in front of you at a glance.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to understand somebody’s intentions or to spot lies.

feats.name: Lockpicker
feats.description:
Doors, safes, and vaults stand no chance against your surgically precise methods.
Gain a Free Re-roll when trying to pick any lock, door, or closed container.

feats.name: Marksman
feats.description:
There are many rifles like yours, but nobody uses a rifle like you do.
Gain a Free Re-roll when using, repairing, evaluating, or handling a rifle, shotgun, sub-machine or machine gun.

feats.name: Martial Arts
feats.description:
You know kung fu, muay thai, boxing, or another fighting style.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all Action and Reaction Rolls made when fighting unarmed.

feats.name: Master of Disguise
feats.description:
You know how to change your appearance and hide your identity.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to disguise yourself, to go unnoticed, or to take on someone else’s identity.

feats.name: Mastermind
feats.description:
Your brilliant ideas allow you to always come out on top.
Repeat one roll of any kind. Ignore all -1s from Conditions and circumstances.

feats.name: Mechanic
feats.description:
You grew up in a workshop and know everything about engines.
Gain a Free Re-roll when building or repairing Rides and other gear.

feats.name: Military Background
feats.description:
You’re a soldier. You know military hierarchy and protocol.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls about military knowledge, for coordinating a strategy, or when recalling your training.

feats.name: Outsmart
feats.description:
As you always say: work smart, not hard!
Make an Action or Reaction Roll of any kind using Know instead of the required Skill.

feats.name: Parkour
feats.description:
You’re a free runner or an expert acrobat. You don’t go down the stairs, you jump the whole ramp.
Gain a Free Re-roll when jumping, performing feats of acrobatics, or breaking a fall.

feats.name: Pep Talk
feats.description:
When the game gets hard, everyone gathers around you, and you always know just what to say.
Gain a Free Re-roll when inspiring or coordinating others.

feats.name: Physician
feats.description:
You’re a nurse, medical doctor, or paramedic. You’re certainly not squeamish about blood.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to find a diagnosis, to operate on someone, or to remove physical Conditions such as the Hurt Condition

feats.name: Pickpocket
feats.description:
You’re no mere thief, you’re a theft artist.
Gain a Free Re-roll when stealing something from somebody.

feats.name: Proven Driver
feats.description:
Engines are your passion. You’re unrivaled at the wheel.
Choose one type of ride (i.e., cars, bikes, flying, etc.)
Gain a Free Re-roll when driving, repairing, or evaluating rides of your chosen type.

feats.name: Punch Reload
feats.description:
After suffering a big hit, you clench your fists and keep on fighting.
[Quick Action] Once per combat, after failing a Reaction Roll against an Enemy, you can stand back up and immediately gain 1 Adrenaline Luck.

feats.name: Reporter
feats.description:
You’re always on the hunt for truth. Your pen is mightier than a gun.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to interview people, gain information, and find contacts.

feats.name: Scientist
feats.description:
It could work! And you know exactly how.
Choose a STEM discipline (i.e.: engineering, chemistry, botany, etc.).
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls regarding your chosen discipline.

feats.name: Selfless
feats.description:
You always defend other people with your life. You’re a true hero!
Gain a Free Re-roll when defending or saving others, or when acting selflessly.

feats.name: Shadow
feats.description:
Nobody can catch you. You’re quick and quiet as a shadow.
Gain a Free Re-roll when hiding, sneaking, or tailing someone.

feats.name: Silver Tongue
feats.description:
Your words speak louder than actions, and you certainly know how to talk your way out of trouble.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to lie, to persuade others, to find a compromise, or to bargain.

feats.name: Spinout
feats.description:
You pull the break and quickly turn the wheel. Everyone better hold on tight.
[Full Turn] All Heroes on the ride you are driving skip their Reaction Turn during a Chase. Flip a coin. Heads: -1 Speed. Tails: +1 Speed.

feats.name: That’s All?
feats.description:
You are hard to persuade and even harder to impress.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to show courage, to withstand pain, and to resist threats or interrogations.

feats.name: Too Young to Die
feats.description:
You’re young and carefree. You feel like nothing can stop you.
When filling in the Bad Box, you suffer no Condition.
You can only gain this Feat when creating a Young Hero.

feats.name: Ambush
feats.description:
When they notice you, it’s already too late.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all Action Rolls made to attack unaware targets with melee weapons or bare hands.

feats.name: Attack Dog
feats.description:
Your dog never barks, they only bite.
When fighting side by side with your Trained Dog, you have a Free Re-roll for all Action and Reaction Rolls made to fight against Enemies in Melee or Close Range.

feats.name: Bad Name
feats.description:
Your reputation precedes you.
You immediately gain a Reputation, 1 Gold, $1 and 1 Adrenaline/Luck

feats.name: Beware of the Owner
feats.description:
They can do anything to you, but they better not touch your dog.
[Quick Action] Once per combat or scene, after your Trained Dog has lost 1 Grit, you immediately gain 1 Adrenaline/Luck.

feats.name: Catch!
feats.description:
You flick your hand, and your dog leaps to attack.
[Quick Action] Your Trained Dog bites a target within Close Range. The target loses 1 Grit, or you gain +1 Speed during a chase on foot.

feats.name: Deflect Bullets
feats.description:
You are so fast, that you can even cut bullets in half mid-flight.
Requires the Sword Fighter Feat. Using your sword, you deflect a hail of bullets without needing to roll the dice. Flip a coin. Heads: You ricochet one bullet back to the shooter and the Enemy loses 1 Grit.

feats.name: Determination
feats.description:
Your inner strength cannot be shaken.
Make a Reaction Roll of any kind using Endure +1 instead of the required Skill.

feats.name: Elegance
feats.description:
When you walk by, everyone stops to look. Such class!
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls involving high society, showing off your refined manners, or when recalling the rules of etiquette.

feats.name: Endure Pain
feats.description:
No pain!
Remove one Condition from yourself. You cannot remove the Broken Condition this way.

feats.name: Expedient
feats.description:
You always know how to get by.
Make an Action or Reaction Roll of any kind using Streetwise instead of the required Skill.

feats.name: Feint
feats.description:
You fight using your head, not just your hands.
Repeat an Action Roll against an Enemy, ignore all Conditions.

feats.name: Gun Fu
feats.description:
Your unique fighting style is a mixture of point-blank gunshots and martial arts. So cool.
When fighting with a loaded pistol or revolver, you have a Free Re-roll for all Action and Reaction Rolls made to fight against Enemies in Melee or Close Range.

feats.name: Leap
feats.description:
You somehow always manage to land on a soft surface.
Jump from any height, you land without consequences. Additionally, when you jump onto your Enemies to attack them from up high, you always have +1.

feats.name: Live and Learn
feats.description:
You know how to learn from mistakes. Especially other people’s.
After another Hero has failed a roll, you automatically succeed in the same roll without rolling the dice.

feats.name: Pass the Buck
feats.description:
To err is human, but only suckers pay their own consequences.
A friend suffers the consequences of a failure instead of you.

feats.name: Rescue
feats.description:
Your dog always swoops in to get you out of trouble at the very last second.
Your Trained Dog prevents a Hero from suffering the Broken Condition, or saves a Hero who lost their spin on the Death Roulette. The rescued Hero adds a Lethal Bullet to their roulette as usual.

feats.name: Savoir Faire
feats.description:
You can get through all hardships with grace and good manners.
Make an Action or Reaction Roll of any kind using Style instead of the required Skill.

feats.name: Sniffer
feats.description:
Nothing can escape the hyper-trained nose of your dog.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to follow a trail or to locate an enemy ambush while you’re with your Trained Dog.
As a Quick Action, you may spend 1 adrenaline/luck to find an Enemy’s Weak Spot.

feats.name: Sword Fighter
feats.description:
In a world filled with guns, you decided to be the guy with a sword.
Gain a Free Re-roll when using, repairing, evaluating, or handling a sword or another melee weapon.

feats.name: Vanish
feats.description:
Now they see you. Now they don’t.
[Quick Action] You get out of a dangerous or uncomfortable situation, or abandon a chase or combat without needing to roll the dice.
You can spend 1 additional to reappear in another position within Medium Range.

feats.name: Whirlwind
feats.description:
When the going gets tough, the tough start spinning their blades.
Requires the Sword Fighter Feat. After striking an Enemy with a Melee weapon, you can make a second Action Roll with -1. You do not have a Free Re-roll for this roll.

feats.name: Alien Diplomat
feats.description:
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to interact with aliens, and for all rolls regarding alien cultures and civilizations.
Additionally, you don’t suffer the usual -1 when interacting with aliens.

feats.name: Hyperlight Evasion
feats.description:
It’s a risky move, but it has saved your life on several occasions.
If, at the end of a Reaction Turn during a Chase none of the Heroes has failed their roll, you can jump to hyperlight on the spot and leave your pursuers in the space dust.
You can also activate this Feat when you skip your Reaction Turn thanks to the Spinout Feat.

feats.name: Shoot First
feats.description:
Shoot first, ask questions later.
You can shoot at a distracted or unprepared target, you have +2 to the roll. Alternatively, when combat should start on a Reaction Turn, you can choose to have it start with an Action Turn instead.

feats.name: Star Pilot
feats.description:
Your starship can cover any route in less than 12 Parsecs!
Gain a Free Re-roll when piloting, repairing, or evaluating starships of any size and make.

feats.name: Amphibian (Alien)
feats.description:
You look like an amphibian, a reptile, or a fish.
You can breathe underwater and gain +1 to all rolls made to swim or take physical actions while underwater.

feats.name: Big Guy (Alien)
feats.description:
You’re a big guy, perhaps even a big hairy guy.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Brawn rolls.
You suffer -1 to all rolls in Dexterity.

feats.name: Brainiac (Alien)
feats.description:
Your mind is better than any computer.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Focus rolls.
You suffer -1 to all rolls in Flirt.

feats.name: Little Guy (Alien)
feats.description:
You’re about half as tall as a human, possibly less. But you’re quick!
Gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls in Stunt and Stealth.

feats.name: Prehensile Appendages (Alien)
feats.description:
You have a tail, an extra set of arms, or some sticky tentacles.
You can rely on one extra hand to carry objects or use items.
During your Action Turn, you can take 2 Quick Actions for free, instead of 1.

feats.name: Shapeshifter (Alien)
feats.description:
You can change your appearance at will.
[Quick Action] You take on the appearance of another alien or human.
You can revert to your original form by using a Quick Action. When you do this, you immediately gain 1 adrenaline/luck.

feats.name: Synth (Alien)
feats.description:
Your body is completely or partially artificial.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Fix rolls. Additionally, you do not suffer a Condition when filling in your Bad Box.
It takes a Fix roll instead of a Heal roll to remove the Hurt condition from you.

feats.name: Ancient Martial Style
feats.description:
You practice an ancient lethal fighting style.
Descriptions in Book. Choose one of the 10 Fighting Styles:
♦ Bear Style
♦ Butterfly Style
♦ Crane Style
♦ Dragon Style
♦ Drunken Style
♦ Eagle Style
♦ Iron Rings Style
♦ Mantis Style
♦ Monkey Style
♦ Tiger Style

feats.name: En Garde!
feats.description:
Your defenses are impenetrable.
You and a friend gain +1 to your next Reaction Roll against an Enemy.

feats.name: Sword Fighter
feats.description:
Nobody can escape your blade.
Gain a Free Re-roll when using, repairing, evaluating, or handling a sword or another melee weapon.

feats.name: Panache
feats.description:
You’re as elegant as a butterfly, and as quick as a bee.
During combat, you can make an Action or Reaction Roll of any kind using Smooth+Style instead of the required Skill.

feats.name: Rider
feats.description:
When you break out at full gallop, nobody can keep up with you.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls made to ride a horse.
[Quick Action] When you’re out in the open, or in any place a horse can reach, you can spend 1 Adrenaline/Luck to call your steed.

feats.name: Elemental Power (Super)
feats.description:
You have an unshakable bond with an element, and you know how to tap into that power.
You can manipulate an element of your choice between water, fire, storm, ice, or earth. For example, you can freeze an item, turn the flame of a lighter into a blaze, or cause the wind to pick up. When you want to use your power in bigger ways, the Director may ask you to make an Action Roll, to spend Adrenaline, or both.
Additionally, add the Elemental Attack weapon to your gear. Gain a Free Re-roll when using your Elemental Attack.
Magazines for the Elemental Attack represent your own energy reserves, but for the purposes of the game, they follow the same rules as normal mags. You start the game with 3 mags and regain spent mags only after a Time-Out.

feats.name: Flight (Super)
feats.description:
You can control gravity around you, or have a beautiful set of wings.
You can fly freely and are able to hover.

feats.name: Gadget (Super)
feats.description:
You own an extraordinary, magical, or high-tech item unique in the world.
Gain one gadget of your choice. You and the Director can design your own gadget, or you can choose from:
Retractable Claws: When using these claws, you gain +1 to all rolls made to attack or wound someone, but all your attacks are potentially lethal.
Spiderweb: Helps you to climb, jump, or hold things together.
Returning Weapon: This throwing weapon always comes back to you, and you can recall it at any time.

feats.name: Hyper-Technological Armor (Super)
feats.description:
Charge into battle with a futuristic set of armor that is somehow connected to your heart.
When you’re wearing the armor, you gain +1 to all rolls made to dodge bullets, and ignore penalties from the Hurt or Broken Conditions. Additionally, your score in Brawn is always equal to 3.
You can spend adrenaline to extract one firearm of any kind from within your armor.
Putting on this set of armor requires a Full Action. You can spend 1 Adrenaline/Luck to recall the armor when it’s far away and put it on in seconds without using an action.

feats.name: Laser (Super)
feats.description:
You shoot lasers out of your eyes, or can emit beams of pure energy.
Add the Laser Beam weapon to your gear.
Gain a Free Re-roll when fighting with your Laser Beam.
Magazines for the Laser Beam represent your own energy reserves, but for the purposes of the game, they follow the same rules as normal mags. When you empty a mag to go full auto, your Laser Beam temporarily gains the Explosive Feat. You start the game with 3 mags and regain spent mags only after a Time-Out.

feats.name: Mind Powers (Super)
feats.description:
Your mind is stronger than you’d think, you just need to learn how to control it.
You can push, pull, or block things and people with the power of your mind by making a roll in Focus+Cool. Additionally, you can communicate telepathically.
Adrenaline/Luck: [Quick Action] Gain access to a person’s mind to influence their actions. In combat, this skill allows you to find 2 Enemy Weak Spots and choose the one you prefer.

feats.name: Regeneration (Super)
feats.description:
Your body can regenerate endlessly. You are unstoppable.
Whenever you stand to lose 3 or more Grit, you lose 1 less Grit.
Adrenaline/Luck: [Quick Action] Remove one Condition from yourself. You cannot remove the Broken Condition this way.

feats.name: Ruler of the Sea (Super)
feats.description:
You can do more than talk to fish... But yes, you talk to fish.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls while you’re underwater. Gain +1 to all rolls made to swim.
You can communicate with fish and other sea-dwelling creatures.
Adrenaline/Luck: [Quick Action] Call on one or several sea creatures to come to your side, they will help however they can.

feats.name: Super Senses (Super)
feats.description:
Nothing can elude your hyperdeveloped senses.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all Reaction Rolls against Enemy Special Actions and for all rolls made to sense danger, to prevent an ambush, or to spot lurking enemies.
Adrenaline/Luck: Repeat a failed Awareness roll.

feats.name: Super Speed (Super)
feats.description:
Maybe you can’t run faster than light, but you’re still a flash!
When you’re not moving, you always have +1 to rolls made to dodge bullets. You can move within Medium Range as a Quick Action, and within Long Range as a Full Action.
Adrenaline/Luck: [Quick Action] You speed up and everything around you appears in slow motion.
For each spent, choose one of the following actions:
♦ You or a friend dodge an attack or projectile without rolling the dice
♦ Steal an object within Close Range
♦ You move Out of Range
♦ Reach a friend within Medium Range, give them an object or take one from
them, and get back
♦ Change your clothes

feats.name: Super Strength (Super)
feats.description:
You can turn into a brightly-colored, musclebound giant, or you’re just way too strong to be human.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Brawn rolls.
You gain +2 to a Brawn roll.

feats.name: Better than Walking
feats.description:
Why walk when you can dart around on wheels?
Choose one kind of non-motorized ride (i.e. Bicycle, skateboard, rollerblades, etc.)
Gain a Free Re-roll when driving, repairing, or evaluating non-motorized rides of your chosen type.

feats.name: Nice Aim
feats.description:
You never miss.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to hit a target with a throwing weapon, a slingshot, or a rock.

feats.name: Popular
feats.description:
At school, everyone wishes they could be as cool as you.
You immediately gain a Reputation, 1$, and 1 adrenaline/luck.

feats.name: Sporty
feats.description:
You’re a promising young athlete. Keep it up!
Choose a sport (i.e. Baseball, basketball, football, etc.)
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls connected to your sport.

feats.name: Arcanimal
feats.description:
You can transform in an animal that represents your spirit.
Choose a single animal form (i.e. Black dog, mouse, peregrine falcon, etc.)
[Full Turn] Transform into your animal form. You can spend 1 adrenaline/luck to transform as a Quick Action.

feats.name: Magical Scholar
feats.description:
Your true strength lies in knowledge.
You know 1 additional spell.
During a Time-Out, you can spend both of your actions to memorize a spell you do not know. You can cast that spell once before your next Time-Out.

feats.name: Spell Slinger
feats.description:
You are an expert arcane fighter.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to hit with the spells Magical Dart, Magic Burst, and Arcane Blast.

feats.name: In the Face of Danger
feats.description:
Danger? You laugh in the face of danger!
When you face off with a Boss or an alien, supernatural, or magical creature,
you earn 1 adrenaline/luck.

feats.name: Know Your Enemy
feats.description:
You know one thing for sure, if it bleeds, you can kill it.
Choose one non-human Enemy (i.e. predator alien, vampire, ghost, etc.).
[Quick Action] Find the Weak Spot of an Enemy of your chosen type.
Additionally, if you’re not in combat, Enemies of your chosen type always have 2 Weak Spots.

feats.name: Not Today
feats.description:
When death calls for you, you answer “Not today”
When you must take a spin on the Death Roulette, you may roll 2 dice and choose the result you prefer.

feats.name: Watch Out!
feats.description:
Your eyes and ears are open. You always watch yours and your friends’ backs.
Another Hero gains +1 to one Reaction Roll, or one Roll Death of any kind.

feats.name: Paranormal Knowledge
feats.description:
You are an expert on paranormal activity, ectoplasm, and psycho-kinetics.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Focus rolls regarding ghosts and paranormal phenomena.

feats.name: Unimpressed
feats.description:
You’ve seen worse. You’ve been through worse.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to remain cool and show courage when facing a ghost or another paranormal phenomenon, and to resist ghost powers.

feats.name: Damned
feats.description:
You were touched by evil. You are a day-walking vampire, the child of a forbidden union, or the victim of a curse.
You gain one Monstrous Feat of your choice. Add this Feat in the same slot where you note the Damned Feat.

feats.name: Occult Knowledge
feats.description:
The more you learn about monsters, the more you realize that some secrets are best kept hidden.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Focus rolls regarding monsters and supernatural phenomena.

feats.name: Pure-Hearted
feats.description:
There’s a light within you that can never be tarnished.
Gain +1 to withstand fear, see through lies, and resist seduction while interacting with a monster. Additionally, you gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls made to avoid falling prey to a monster’s supernatural powers.

feats.name: Vampire/Werewolf Scourge
feats.description:
No creature can escape your blade.
Choose one type of monster. You gain a Free Re-roll for all Action and Reaction Rolls to fight against your chosen type of monster, and for all rolls made to follow their tracks and identify them.

feats.name: Lycanthrope (Werewolves Only) (Monstrous)
feats.description:
You are a wild creature, half human and half beast.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Brawn rolls. On nights of the full moon, you turn into a Beast.
Beast: You gain +1 to dodge bullets, and ignore penalties from the Hurt or Broken Conditions. Additionally, your score in Brawn is always equal to 3. At sunrise, or when you have Lost all Grit, you revert to human form and look Tired.
Weakness: You suffer -1 to all rolls made against Anti-werewolf guns and other silver items.

feats.name: Nosferatu (Vampires Only) (Monstrous)
feats.description:
You are a child of the night, born again with a thirst for blood.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Nerves rolls. When you feed on human blood, you may heal from one Condition of any kind.
Weakness: You suffer -1 to all rolls made against Anti-vampire guns.
If you are exposed to sunlight, you cannot call on your Monstrous Feats and look Tired. If you do not return to the shadows on the next turn, you become Nervous, then Hurt, then Broken. From the fifth turn onward, you must take a spin on the Death Roulette every turn.

feats.name: Bite (Monstrous)
feats.description:
You plunge your fangs in your victim to feast on their blood or their pain.
After landing a blow on an enemy in Melee or Close Range, you may spend 1 Adrenaline/Luck to bite them and recover 3 Grit.

feats.name: Dark Instinct (Monstrous)
feats.description:
Your sharp senses allow you to hear everything and see through lies.
Gain a Free Re-roll to preempt dangers or ambushes, to locate lurking enemies, or to recognize lies.
Adrenaline/Luck: Repeat a failed Awareness or Detect roll.

feats.name: Mind Control (Monstrous)
feats.description:
You can breach through the defenses of the human psyche thanks to your powers or super-human instincts.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls made to charm or intimidate others.
[Quick Action] Gain access to a person’s mind to try to sway their actions.
In combat, this skill allows you to find 2 Enemy Weak Spots and choose the one you prefer.You can breach through the defenses of the human psyche thanks to your powers or super-human instincts.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls made to charm or intimidate others.
Adrenaline/Luck: [Quick Action] Gain access to a person’s mind to try to sway their actions.
In combat, this skill allows you to find 2 Enemy Weak Spots and choose the one you prefer.

feats.name: Monstrous Movements (Monstrous)
feats.description:
You’re quick and elusive as a shadow. You are the apex predator.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls in Stunt and gain +1 to jump, climb, or hang.

feats.name: Regeneration (Monstrous)
feats.description:
Your blood is strong. Wounds aren’t enough to stop you.
Whenever you stand to lose 3 or more Grit, you lose 1 less Grit.
Adrenaline/Luck: [Quick Action] Remove one Condition from yourself. You cannot remove the Broken Condition this way.

feats.name: Shift (Monstrous)
feats.description:
You tap into your dark power to turn into a beast or a swarm of bats
Gain one of the following abilities:
Adrenaline/Luck: [Vampire] You dissolve into a swarm of bats to move to a point within Medium Range or to avoid an attack without rolling the dice.
Adrenaline/Luck: [Werewolf] You turn into a Beast until the end of the Scene, even if there is no full moon.

feats.name: Adrenaline Junkie
feats.description:
You live for the thrill. Adrenaline is never enough.
When you spend Adrenaline/Luck to gain +1, your roll automatically becomes a Gamble. If you lose Grit because of this Gamble, you earn 1 Adrenaline/Luck.

feats.name: Cyberpunk
feats.description:
You are part human, part machine. You have accepted this by now.
Gain a Free Re-roll to use or repair your Cyberware.

feats.name: Tormented by the Past
feats.description:
You gain a Scar that represents an event that traumatized you, but also made you stronger.
You gain +1 to all rolls in Endure and Cool.

feats.name: Sprawl
feats.description:
You grew up on the streets of an ultrametropolis, you know how things work around here.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to move through the Sprawl, to find contacts, and to interact with people who live in the slums.

feats.name: Higher Self (Master of Multiverse)
feats.description:
You can channel the power of the Multiverse through your body to reach a higher form of your self, temporarily gaining their abilities.
[Quick Action] Decrease your score in an Attribute from 3 to 2 and increase the score of another Attribute you choose. Additionally, you lose one of your Feats- excluding Higher Self - and gain another Feat of your choosing.
This effect lasts until the end of the Scene, of Combat, or until you decide to willingly stop it.

feats.name: Multiversal Control (Master of Multiverse)
feats.description:
You learned to control the powers of the Multiverse and can sometimes even repair the fabric of reality.
Whenever you take a spin on the Multiverse Roulette, you may roll 2 dice and choose the better result.

feats.name: Osmosis (Master of Multiverse)
feats.description:
You’ve made contact with an alternate version of yourself and have absorbed their powers or abilities.
You immediately gain one Feat of your choice among the ones found in Action Flicks.

feats.name: Possible Futures (Master of Multiverse)
feats.description:
You have already seen what’s coming. You are prepared.
You or another Hero may repeat an Action or Reaction Roll of any kind.

feats.name: Archaeology
feats.description:
You know history and the myths that surround it like the back of your hand.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls regarding archaeology, dead languages, or the history, culture, and legends of ancient civilizations.

feats.name: Big and Strong
feats.description:
You’re unbelievably tall, large, and bulky.
Your considerable size grants you Help whenever you try to lift or break objects, but it poses a Hindrance when you try to hide in small spaces or balance your mass in unsteady situations.

feats.name: Bodyguard
feats.description:
You step in at the last second to help your friend, disregarding your own safety and health.
After another Adventurer fails a roll, you suffer the consequences of their failure (for example, if your friend should lose Grit or suffer a Condition, you lose Grit or suffer the Condition in their stead).

feats.name: Chin Up
feats.description:
Even in the darkest times, your friends can always rely on you.
[Full Turn] Remove the Scared or Like a Fool Condition, or another emotional Condition from an ally. Alternatively, while at Camp, you can take the Cheer Up action without needing to roll the dice.

feats.name: Disguise
feats.description:
In the bag, you see an officer’s uniform. And it’s in your size.
[Full Turn] Find, steal, or craft the perfect disguise for yourself and/or one other Adventurer without rolling the dice.

feats.name: Estimate
feats.description:
Every object you see and handle tells you a story, and whispers to you its price.
Gain a Free Re-roll when evaluating or dating precious items, jewels, and ancient artifacts, and when recognizing fakes.

feats.name: Explorer
feats.description:
There is no obstacle you can’t overcome.
Gain a Free Re-roll when climbing, swimming, or traveling in wild environments.

feats.name: Eye for Details
feats.description:
You notice or remember details that elude everyone else.
[Quick Action] You either come up with a detail that can prove helpful in a difficult situation (for example, a loophole or a hidden passage), or ask the Director for a clue or suggestion.

feats.name: Fast Reflexes
feats.description:
You’re always alert, ready, and quick.
React against an Enemy by rolling Brawn+Stunt instead of the requested Skill.
You ignore all -1s from Conditions and circumstances.

feats.name: Favored Weapon
feats.description:
Your weapon is an extension of your arm, and it never fails you.
Choose a melee weapon (e.g. saber, whip, boomerang, etc.). Gain a Free Re-roll when using, repairing, evaluating, or handling the chosen weapon.

feats.name: Fighter
feats.description:
Your fists don't go unnoticed.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all Action and Reaction Rolls made when fighting with your hands against human enemies.

feats.name: Fix-it
feats.description:
If anyone can fix it, that’s you!
Gain a Free Re-roll when repairing rides or disarming traps.

feats.name: Guide
feats.description:
You always know where you are and where you’re going.
Gain a Free Re-roll whenever you’re finding your bearings, following tracks, locating food, or searching for your friends.

feats.name: Hardened
feats.description:
You are afraid of nothing and nobody.
Gain a Free Re-roll when intimidating others or resisting fear.

feats.name: Hawkeye
feats.description:
Your aim never misses.
Choose between hunting rifle or bow. Gain a Free Re-roll when using, repairing, evaluating, or handling that weapon.
You can spend 1 Adrenaline/Luck to repeat an Action Roll made to shoot with your chosen weapon.

feats.name: I Meant to Do That!
feats.description:
You stumble, grab onto a lever, and open a secret passage.
After you fail a Reaction Roll that was not caused by an Enemy, you can immediately generate a lucky turn of events or an unexpected opportunity.

feats.name: Linguist
feats.description:
When you need it, you remember that you studied that language in college, or that you can understand the basics of an unknown dialect.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls made to understand or try to speak an unknown language.
You can spend 1 Adrenaline/Luck to become Fluent in that language until the end of the Session, without needing to make additional rolls.

feats.name: Maverick
feats.description:
You do things your own way and march to your own tune.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Action Rolls that clearly and openly go against the choices and directions of the rest of the group.

feats.name: Moneybags
feats.description:
You inherited a fortune, or started at rock bottom and built a fortune for yourself.
You start the game with 4 Cash.
[Full Turn] You can spend 1 Adrenaline/Luck to find a contact, passage to somewhere, an invite to an event, or another service thanks to your huge wealth or fame.

feats.name: Pilot
feats.description:
You feel truly at peace only when you’re above the clouds.
Gain a Free Re-roll when piloting, repairing, or evaluating flying rides.

feats.name: Quick and Nimble
feats.description:
You are lithe, thin, or especially slight.
Your slender frame grants you Help whenever you try to hide, sneak, or balance, but it poses a Hindrance when you try to lift or break objects.

feats.name: Quick Fingers
feats.description:
If you want something, you just need to get your hands on it.
Gain a Free Re-roll when using sleight of hand.
[Full Turn] You can spend 1 Adrenaline/Luck to immediately retrieve a small item you lost during this Session, or to ensure a small object goes unnoticed during a search or check.

feats.name: Reassure
feats.description:
You lock eyes with your friend, and let them know you believe in them.
Grant +1 to another Adventurer who is about to roll 4 dice or fewer, or allow a friend who has filled in their Bad Box to avoid suffering a Condition.

feats.name: Saddle Up
feats.description:
You grab your friend and start running without looking back.
[Quick Action] You and one other Adventurer skip the next Reaction Turn while running.

feats.name: Sailor
feats.description:
You have salt water in your veins.
Gain a Free Re-roll when driving, repairing, or evaluating a nautical ride.

feats.name: Sensible Packer
feats.description:
Not even you know what’s in your backpack, but you􀈾re sure that there’s something useful.
Your Bag and Backpack never become a Hiindrance to you, regardless of the circumstances.
[Quick Action] So long as you are carrying your Bag or Backpack, you can spend 1 Adrenaline/Luck to find a tool or weapon in it. The item found can’t be worth more than $2, is not in sellable condition, and becomes unserviceable after the end of this Scene.

feats.name: Skulker
feats.description:
Your prey stands no chance.
Gain a Free Re-roll when hiding or sneaking in wild environments. Additionally, you ignore all drawbacks from Partial Cover when you’re in the wilds.

feats.name: Specialist
feats.description:
No worry: this is your specialty.
Choose one technical specialty (e.g.: demolition, radio, excavation, etc.).
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls regarding your chosen specialty.

feats.name: Subterfuge
feats.description:
What the others don’t know can’t hurt them. And most importantly, it can't hurt you.
Gain a Free Re-roll when lying, deceiving, or cheating.

feats.name: Teamwork
feats.description:
Someone distracts them, and you strike. That’s what I call teamwork!
[Full Turn] After another Adventurer gave you an Assist this Turn, you can spend 1 Adrenaline/Luck to gain an automatic success without rolling the dice.

feats.name: That Was Close!
feats.description:
Thanks to your instincts or to a stroke of luck, you move away before it’s too late.
Repeat one Reaction Roll of any kind. Ignore all -1s from Conditions and circumstances. You must keep the new result.

feats.name: Thrill Seeker
feats.description:
When things get serious, just get out of the line of fire.
Gain a Free Re-roll when dodging bullets, arrows, or triggered traps, and for all rolls to get out of the way and find cover.

feats.name: Trailblazer
feats.description:
Where others see obstacles, you 􀅥nd a path.
[Full Turn] Create a safe path, an alternative route, some space, or an opening thanks to your technical or natural knowledge.

feats.name: Watch and Learn
feats.description:
If they can do it, so can you.
After another Adventurer succeeds in an Action Roll this Turn, you automatically succeed in the same action without rolling the dice.

feats.name: Acrobat
feats.description:
You move with great deftness and precision, and you always land on your feet.
Gain a Free Re-roll when jumping, performing feats of acrobatics, or breaking a fall.

feats.name: Astral Focus
feats.description:
You are one with the Power. The Power is with you.
[Full Turn] If you have 0 or 1 adrenaline, you immediately gain 1 adrenaline. You cannot use this Feat on two consecutive Turns.

feats.name: Astral Sword Fighter
feats.description:
The star-shard that ignites the Power within your sword is a reflection of your soul.
Gain a Free Re-roll when using, repairing, evaluating, or handling star swords.

feats.name: Inner Peace
feats.description:
You are as unblinking as a mountain. You exude serenity.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls made to resist intimidation, fear, or charm, as well as to rolls made to hold onto your Balance.

feats.name: Lightning Reflexes
feats.description:
Your senses are so sharp that you are nearly clairvoyant.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Reaction Rolls in Drive, Awareness, and Dexterity.

feats.name: Alure of the Forbidden
feats.description:
What everyone else calls scary, you’ve always found to be fascinating. Nothing wrong with asking questions, right?
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Focus rolls regarding cosmic horror, magical rituals, as well as to all rolls made to use Forbidden items.

feats.name: Memory of a Dream
feats.description:
You remember this place. Or was it just a dream?
Once per Session, you can ask the Director for a piece of information, a clue, or a help of some kind. The answer will take the form of a strange vision. Nothing but a memory of a distant dream. Additionally, you can spend 1 Adrenaline to repeat a failed Detect roll. Your sixth  sense will guide you.

feats.name: On the Brink
feats.description:
All it would take is a little push, and your mind would fall into madness. One little push.
When you gain 1 Madness, you also automatically gain 1 Adrenaline. Once per Session, when you fail a roll of any kind, you can choose to gain 1 Madness. If you do so, your failure turns into a supernatural or inexplicable success.

feats.name: Straight-Faced
feats.description:
You’ve gazed into the abyss, and shrugged. It looks like nothing can faze you.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to show composure and courage when facing cosmic horrors, and to resist Madness.

feats.name: Eyes of Steel
feats.description:
Your eyes narrow, braving the midday sun day after day, and yet they remain as cold as steel.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls made to intimidate others.
During the Stare-off of a Quick Draw duel, you can choose to move a single die from your Stare-off pool to your Draw pool, or vice-versa. You must make this choice after seeing how many dice your Challenger is rolling, but before the two of you make the roll.

feats.name: Fast Reload
feats.description:
During a shootout, every second can make a difference between life and the grave.
During a combat scene, you can spend 1 Adrenaline to reload a weapon you are holding without using up an action.

feats.name: Hair-Trigger
feats.description:
When others are reaching for their pistol, you have fired already.
After shooting a bullet toward an Enemy, you can immediately make a second Action Roll with -1. You do not have a Free Re-roll for this roll. Requires the Gunslinger Feat.

feats.name: Rider
feats.description:
When you break out at full gallop, nobody can keep up with you.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls made to ride a horse.
Adrenaline: [Quick Action] When you’re out in the open, or in any place a horse can reach, you can spend 1 Adrenaline to call your steed.

feats.name: Cursed/Blessed
feats.description:
You are a human being with Angelic or Demonic ascendancy. The circumstances that have marked you like this are more than unique.
You gain one Otherworldly Feat of your choice. Add this Feat in the same slot where you note the Cursed/Blessed Feat.

feats.name: Holy/Unholy Weapon
feats.description:
You wield a weapon that can channel otherworldly energy.
You have a Holy or Unholy melee weapon (e.g.: an angelic sword, or a fiendish axe).
When fighting with that weapon, you (and only you) gain +1 to all Action Rolls made to harm creatures from the opposite side. This modifier does NOT stack with the normal +1 granted by the Celestial or Infernal Otherworldly Feat.

feats.name: Otherworldly Connection
feats.description:
You have a special connection with an Angel or Demon.
Choose a Supporting Character or another Hero who is an Angel or Demon you are connected to. Whenever they want, the creature you are connected to can allow you to spend 1 of their Adrenaline or choose to spend 1 of your Adrenaline without asking permission.
Adrenaline: [Quick Action] You summon the creature you are connected with, wherever they are. If they wish, and they are not being held by otherworldly forces or barriers, they immediately appear beside you.

feats.name: Otherworldly Knowledge
feats.description:
Even in an endless war, there is always new information to learn about your foes.
Choose either holy or unholy knowledge. Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls to recall information on characters, phenomena, hierarchies, or powers of that type.

feats.name: Celestial (Otherworldly)
feats.description:
You’re a member of the angelic hosts and represent good in the great design.
You are a Holy creature, and are surrounded by an aura of holy light that can usually only be perceived by Angels and Demons. You gain +1 to all Action Rolls made to strike Unholy creatures with your bare hands or melee weapons, and suffer -1 to all Reaction Rolls made to defend against the attacks of Unholy creatures.
Adrenaline: [Quick Action] You can use your powers to perform a small miracle. For example, you summon a beautifully crafted item of small size, inspire good will in others, emanate a warm and comforting light, soothe pain in someone who’s suffering, heal a minor wound, or bring back to life a small creature such as a dove or butterfly.

feats.name: Infernal (Otherworldly)
feats.description:
You’re a member of the demonic hosts and represent evil in the great design.
You are an Unholy creature, and are surrounded by a dark, unholy aura that can usually only be perceived by Angels and Demons. You gain +1 to all Action Rolls made to strike Holy creatures with your bare hands or melee weapons, and suffer -1 to all Reaction Rolls made to defend against the attacks of Holy creatures.
Adrenaline: [Quick Action] You can use your power to unleash a small curse. For example, you summon a swarm of insects or vermin, incite negative emotions in others, unleash pesky mishaps, create light sensory illusions like annoying smells or noises, or make the weather worse.

feats.name: Heal/Harm (Otherworldly)
feats.description:
Your powers allow you to heal the sick or inflict grievous wounds.
Adrenaline: [Full Turn] You can heal yourself or another Hero from a Condition of any kind, or cause an Enemy from the opposing side to lose 1 Grit.

feats.name: Resurrection (Otherworldly)
feats.description:
Your friends in high places, or low places, can even bring you back from the dead.
When you’re Left for Dead, you can return to the game with a Bond instead of a Scar. The Bond is a debt you now owe to those who brought you back to life. Additionally, and only once per Cinematic Campaign, you may use this Feat to return during the Scene or Shot after you have been Left for Dead.

feats.name: Teleportation (Otherworldly)
feats.description:
You can disappear in a flash or puff of smoke and reappear (somewhere else).
When you have the time and peace you need, you can always teleport to a place of your choice, no matter how far.
Adrenaline: [Full Turn] When you are surrounded by threats, for example during a chase or combat, you can spend 1 Adrenaline to teleport to a safe place.

feats.name: Transfiguration (Otherworldly)
feats.description:
You have many faces and many voices, but none of them is yours.
You take on the appearance of a subject of your choice. You can choose a Hero, a Supporting Character, or give a generic or original description.
While the transfiguration remains active, you can also hide your aura. When you return to your own appearance, you immediately gain 1 Adrenaline.

feats.name: Wings (Otherworldly)
feats.description:
You can take flight on wings that no mortal creature can see.
You can manifest a pair of wings that allow you to fly. If you’re an Angel, the wings are white and feathered, if you’re a Demon, they are dark and leathery, like a bat’s.
The wings can only be seen by other otherworldly creatures, unless you choose to willingly make them visible to human beings.

feats.name: Wisdom of Babel (Otherworldly)
feats.description:
You can tap into the original source of knowledge.
Until the end of the Scene, you gain the ability to speak every language or learn about something theoretical, technical, or practical of any kind that can grant you Help in the current circumstances.

feats.name: Battle Cry
feats.description:
Your cry echoes in the hearts of your opponents, filling them with dread.
Once per Session, you can unleash your battle cry to gain 1 adrenaline, to remove from yourself a Condition of any kind, or to immediately recover 3 Grit.
In order for this Feat to take effect, you must unleash your battle cry in real life.

feats.name: Bulwark
feats.description:
Your armor is like a second skin to you, you can even sleep while wearing it.
While wearing a suit of armor, you ignore all effects of the Bulky Weapon Feat.

feats.name: Mythical Warrior
feats.description:
You and your weapon are inseparable. Your foes and their limbs much less so.
Choose a weapon (e.g. sword, axe, spear,...). Gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls involving the chosen weapon.
Adrenaline: Gain +1 and ignore all Conditions for a single Action Roll with the chosen weapon.

feats.name: Trick Shot
feats.description:
It doesn’t matter how many times you throw your weapon, it will keep bouncing back to you. Don’t question it, it just does.
When you hurl a throwing weapon, so long as you score at least a Basic Success, it will always return back to your hand.
This feat doesn’t work with spears, or other two-handed weapons.

feats.name: First Day
feats.description:
You’re the newest recruit, and you can still rely on beginner’s luck.
Once per Session, when you need to make a roll with less than 4 dice, you can choose to gain +2. If you succeed, it’s due to sheer dumb luck.

feats.name: Rank
feats.description:
You are a high-ranking member of the force, and everyone respects you.
You gain +1 to all rolls in Smooth when interacting with other members of the force.

feats.name: Too Old for This
feats.description:
You are too old for this job, and you never miss a chance to repeat it when there are criminals to chase, or stairs to climb.
You can choose to automatically fail an Action Roll that requires physical effort. When you do this, mark an X near this Feat. You can mark only one X at a time, and will only be allowed to mark another after erasing the first.
You can erase the X at any time to gain +1 and a Free Re-roll in an Action Roll of any kind, thanks to the knowledge you have accumulated over your long years of honored service.

feats.name: They Owe Me One
feats.description:
You know people everywhere, and many of them owe you a debt of gratitude, which will motivate them (or force them) to help you in your time of need.
Call in an old debt to gain a small advantage, like access to a private area, a useful piece of information, a specific item of gear, or some preferential treatment.

feats.name: Paleontology
feats.description:
You’ve been obsessed with dinosaurs since you were a kid. Nobody knows them like you do.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all Focus and Crime rolls regarding dinosaurs, their behavior, and their habits.

feats.name: Runner
feats.description:
Even in heels, nobody can keep up with you when you start running.
Gain +1 to all rolls made to run.

feats.name: Survival Instinct
feats.description:
You have no intention of going extinct today.
Repeat a failed Reaction Roll.
Until the end of the Scene, you ignore all penalties imposed by Conditions.

feats.name: Told You So
feats.description:
You don’t like to say “I told you so”, but you did tell them.
Once per Scene, you can come up with an action plan, or warn someone that they’re about to make a mistake. If your warning is proven true, you can choose to either gain 1 or remove a Condition from yourself. Being right feels good.

feats.name: Veternarian
feats.description:
You have dedicated your life to caring for animals, even those that should be extinct.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to take care of wounded animals, and to interact peacefully with an animal that you haven’t harmed.

feats.name: Furious Pilot
feats.description:
The roar of your engine echoes through the wasteland. Nobody can keep up with you.
When driving a ride during a chase or run, you can always opt to act recklessly or disregard your safety in order to gain +1 to your next Action Roll.
If you do so, flip a coin. If the result is Tails, you also gain 1 . If it’s Heads, everybody else on the ride is tossed about and loses 2 Grit.

feats.name: Jackal
feats.description:
Another man’s junk is your treasure.
Gain a Free Re-roll to all rolls made to recover or evaluate materials, to repair items, or to build Scrap gear.
Additionally, you may spend 1 Adrenaline to quickly retrieve useful junk for your Scrap creations, or knickknacks you can use to reload a Junk Shooter weapon.

feats.name: Road Warrior
feats.description:
You are really tough, even by wasteland standards. That’s why nobody wants to go and play with you.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls made to use Heavy Metal weapons.

feats.name: Witness!
feats.description:
When you do something truly cool, you want everyone to see.
Gain +2 to an Action Roll in Brawn or Nerves to do a crazy stunt, a daring action, or something truly reckless. Then, you lose 2 Grit for every die that is not part of a success. If you lose no Grit, you gain 1 Adrenaline.

feats.name: Carnage
feats.description:
When pieces of zombies start flying, there is nothing that can stop you.
Any melee weapon you wield gains the Slasher 1 Feat.
Whenever you deal the finishing blow to a Zombie Enemy by using a Slasher Weapon, you gain 1 Adrenaline.

feats.name: Fearless
feats.description:
You’re afraid of nothing.
Gain a Free Re-roll for all Cool Rolls, and for all rolls made to withstand fear and shock.
When you become Scared, you can choose to suffer another Condition of your choice instead.

feats.name: Immune
feats.description:
Whatever the cause of this undead epidemic may be, you are the only one to be immune.
When you get bit by a Zombie, you do not suffer any Condition and cannot be turned.
Additionally, when you suffer the Hurt Condition due to a Zombie attack, you can choose to suffer another Condition of your choice instead.
Only one Hero can pick this Feat.

feats.name: Spirit of Sacrifice
feats.description:
You’d do anything for your friends.
Once per Turn, you can choose to suffer -1 to a roll in order to grant +1 to the next roll made by another Hero. If they do so, they lose 1 Grit.

feats.name: Undead
feats.description:
You’re a zombie, but you never lost control over your mind or your emotions.
You are immune to all Conditions, and the Bad Box on your Grit track becomes a Horror Box.
When you fill in your Horror Box because of an Enemy or another physical danger, you can choose to tap into a rush of brutality to make an extra Action Roll, or to gain 1 Adrenaline. If you do so, the rush also causes you to lose a limb or another body-part.
You can reattach any lost pieces by using one of your actions during a Time-Out or Camp, provided that you have a spare (it doesn’t need to be your missing piece).

feats.name: Boing! (Toon)
feats.description:
Your body is nimble and elastic. You get squished, but never broken!
Once per Session, when you lose Grit due to a melee attack by an Enemy, you can say that your body gets momentarily warped, before bouncing back to its original form. If you do this, the Enemy is hit with the backlash and loses 1 Grit.

feats.name: Bottomless Bag (Toon)
feats.description:
Your pockets, bag, hat, or another container you carry has near-infinite capacity.
Choose a container you always carry with you. You can stuff in or take out of that container any number of inanimate objects of all shapes and sizes. Additionally, when you choose this feat, you immediately gain 3 pieces of Gear of your choice, which you keep in that container.

feats.name: Clumsy (Toon)
feats.description:
When you go dancing, you stomp on your feet as well as on others’.
Once per Session, you can choose to gain an automatic success in an absolutely clumsy, blundering way, instead of rolling the dice. In exchange for this, you must choose another Hero who will suffer an automatic failure because of your awkwardness. Apologize to them!

feats.name: Dumb Luck (Toon)
feats.description:
You are way too lucky.
Once per Session, you can choose to gain a clue, obtain a piece of Gear by chance, or automatically gain a Critical Success without needing to roll the dice. When you do this, flip a coin. If the result is Tails, you can reuse this Feat again, as if you had never used it at all. So lucky!

feats.name: Fixation (Toon)
feats.description:
You have a one-track mind, with a passion or an out and out obsession that always gets your heart beating and your eyes shining.
Choose one fixation, like money, cheese, or your love for someone. You gain +1 to all Action and Reaction Rolls made to gain, keep, or reach the object of your desire.

feats.name: Flip Out (Toon)
feats.description:
When you get angry, you see red and become unstoppable.
When something gets you irritated or mad, so long as you have at least 1 , you can choose to flip out. When you flip out, you can always rely on at least 7 dice for all Rolls in Brawn, regardless of your scores and Conditions. However, at the end of each Turn, you must spend 1 Adrenaline, and if you don’t have any more, the effort leaves you Tired.
And if you’re wondering, no, you cannot choose to calm down unless you’ve run out of Adrenaline. Once you flip out, you keep flipping out for as long as you can.

feats.name: Flying (Toon)
feats.description:
Look at you! You can fly!
You can take to the sky thanks to your wings, to an extraordinary power, to a propeller-hat, or to some other weird invention of yours. Anyway, enjoy the flight!

feats.name: I Never Learned Physics (Toon)
feats.description:
You’ve never studied physics, which means you don’t give a damn about its stupid laws. Easy enough, right?
You can spend 1 to ignore the usual consequences of the laws of physics. For example, to delay a fall, stop time for an instant, or to run on water.

feats.name: Imposing (Toon)
feats.description:
You’re big, very big. Twice as tall and broad as the others. What do they feed you?
You gain +1 to all Endure and Force rolls, but suffer -1 to all Dexterity and Stealth rolls.

feats.name: Private Lab (Toon)
feats.description:
In your lab, you have everything you need. Actually, you have everything, period.
Once per Session, if you have the time to do it, you can head to your lab to grab or build… anything. Literally.
Zeppelins, cannons, submarines, perhaps even a time-machine that works almost perfectly most of the times. There’s no limit to what can come out of your lab.

feats.name: Team (Toon)
feats.description:
You are not a single Hero, you are a whole team of Heroes!
You are not playing as a single Hero, but as a pair, or even a trio of Characters who share a single Hero Sheet. This allows you to take several actions, and to coordinate with each-other to do things that would otherwise be impossible.
Bear in mind that your Skills represent the combination of the collective efforts of your team, and that you can only roll the dice once per Turn. Additionally, the members of your little team are never too far from each-other, and if they are forced to do that, they always suffer -1 to all rolls until they are reunited.

feats.name: Teeny (Toon)
feats.description:
You are very small, tiny even. About half as tall and broad as the others. Are they feeding you?
You gain +1 to all Dexterity and Stealth rolls, but suffer -1 to all Endure and Force rolls.

feats.name: 1 Up! (Virtual)
feats.description:
You have an extra life, or know a cheat code to trick the system.
When you’re about to lose a Life, you can choose to not lose it instead, healing from all Conditions and recovering all Grit on the spot. If you do, erase this Feat from your Sheet.

feats.name: Glitch (Virtual)
feats.description:
There’s something wrong with your avatar. Maybe you need to lower the resolution?
You can choose to suffer -1 to a single roll due to a glitch or bug. When you do this, mark an X near this Feat. You can mark only one X at a time, and will only be allowed to mark another after erasing the first.
You can erase the X at any time to gain +1 to a roll of any kind thanks to a lucky glitch.

feats.name: Heavy Machine Gun (Virtual)
feats.description:
You always have the right tool for every situation.
[Quick Action] Once per Scene, you can pull out from your pack or summon a piece of gear, weapon, or ride of your choice. Gain a Free Re-roll for all rolls that use the summoned item.
At the end of the scene, the item vanishes in a cloud of pixels.

feats.name: Limit Break! (Virtual)
feats.description:
Nobody can survive your final move.
[Quick Action] After you fill in your Bad Box, you can make a single attack using 9 dice. You CAN NOT make a Free Re-roll for this roll.

feats.name: Motherload
feats.description:
You just need to input a code, and you’re filthy rich.
So long as you are in the Virtual world, you have infinite Cash. At least until someone notices.

feats.name: Power Up (Virtual)
feats.description:
When things get serious, just activate your power up.
[Quick Action] Scale up one Attribute of your choice. Until the end of the Scene, you gain +1 to all rolls involving the chosen Attribute.
You can use this Feat only once per Session.
